poem:
**Market Tides**

In the cool morning,
shares tumble like unsteady toddlers,
stumbling over words
        
of legal documents,
tiny lives entangled 
in formulas of trust.
        
All the while, investors,
distant as relatives,
watch numbers fall as if

tossed from great heights,
caring more for commas
than cradles.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Reckitt Benckiser’s shares slump after Abbott baby formula ruling over bowel disease link Reckitt Benckiser’s share price has dropped to a 10-year low after a US court ruled that a formula produced by rival Abbott Laboratories had caused a baby girl to develop a serious bowel disease. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
